p: This paper took a long time to write and has gone through various quite radical transformations. For comments, I am grateful to the participants at the conference on ‘Justice, the Family and Public Policy’, New Orleans (February 2014), to audiences at the 2014 Annual OZSW conference, the Workshop on climate and population at the University of Oxford (November 2016), the 2018 Annual conference of the Society for Applied Philosophy, and at seminars at the Erasmus University Rotterdam, the University of Amsterdam, the University of Bristol, Utrecht University and the University of Groningen. I would like to thank in particular Chris Bertram, Elizabeth Brake, Simon Caney, Paula Casal Luara Ferracioli, Anca Gheaus, Julia Hermann, Colin Hickey, Tim Meijers, Serena Olsaretti, Roland Pierik, Gina Schouten, Annemarie van Stee and Andrew Williams for helpful comments and discussions. The funding was provided by H2020 European Research Council (Grant No. 726153).
